text: Moselle Franconian (German: Moselfränkisch) is a variant of West Central German. It is spoken in southern Rhineland and in the Moselle. It is also spoken in North Rhine-Westphalia, western Rhineland-Palatinate, Saarland, Luxembourg, and Belgium. == Varieties == The variants or varieties of Moselle Franconian: * Trierisch * Eifelisch * Untermosellanisch * West-Westerwäldisch * Siegerländisch * Luxembourgish * Lorraine Franconian * Transylvanian Saxon dialect * Hunsrik == Related pages == * Rhine Franconian == References == Category:German dialects Category:Languages of Germany Category:North Rhine- Westphalia Category:Rhineland-Palatinate Category:Saarland Category:Languages of Luxembourg Category:Languages of Belgium Category:Liège (province) Category:Languages of France Category:Lorraine
title: Moselle Franconian language
